item.title: Void Linux on Thinkpad P50
item.description:
Sleep problem

P50 would not wake up from sleep and even worse it would not enter real sleep, instead draining the battery. Only fix was long press on power button to shut it down.

Solution found on reddit:

UEFI Settings -> Security -> Security Chip -> Security Chip Selection

The option that was selected was “Intel PTT”, and switching to “Discrete TPM” (followed by a confirmation) resolved the issue.

item.title: Installing Void Linux on IBM Power 740
item.description:
Going for Void Linux

Recently I switched from Ubuntu to Void Linux on all my boxes. Fortunately Void has great support for PPC. I even have it installed on a Powerbook G3.

For running Linux on PPC you need to know if your CPU support little endian or big endian. PowerPC started as BE and only with Power8 did it fully support LE mode. For a Power7 we need Void Linux ppc64 that is a BE version.
